code._value:
title: "Language schema with errata"
   package: "http://oasis-open.org/openc2/oc2ls/v1.0.1"
   version: "0"

_values:
| Action   | 1    | The task or activity to be performed (i.e., the 'verb').                   |
| 2  |

| Target   | 1    | The object of the Action. The Action is performed on the Target.           |
| 3  |

| Args     | 0..1 | Additional information that applies to the Command.                        |
| 4  |

| Actuator | 0..1 | The subject of the Action. The Actuator executes the Action on the Target. |
| 5  |
| String   | 0..1 | An identifier of this Command.                                             |

| String      | 0..1 | A free-form human-readable description of the Response status                         |
| 3  |
| Results     | 0..1 | Map of key:value pairs that contain additional results based on the invoking Command. |

| Systematic examination of some aspect of the entity or its environment.                                                                 |
| 2  |

| Find an object physically, logically, functionally, or by organization.                                                                 |
| 3  |

| Prevent a certain event or action from completion, such as preventing a flow from reaching a destination or preventing access.          |
| 7  |

| Isolate a file, process, or entity so that it cannot modify or access assets or processes.                                              |
| 8  |

| Permit access to or execution of a Target.                                                                                              |
| 9  |

| Initiate a process, application, system, or activity.                                                                                   |
| 10 |

| Halt a system or end an activity.                                                                                                       |
| 11 |

| Stop then start a system or an activity.                                                                                                |
| 14 |

| Change a value, configuration, or state of a managed entity.                                                                            |
| 16 |

| Instruct a component to retrieve, install, process, and operate in accordance with a software update, reconfiguration, or other update. |
| 18 |

| Change the flow of traffic to a destination other than its original destination.                                                        |
| 19 |

| Add a new entity of a known type (e.g., data, files, directories).                                                                      |
| 20 |

| Remove an entity (e.g., data, files, flows).                                                                                            |
| 22 |

| Execute and observe the behavior of a Target (e.g., file, hyperlink) in an isolated environment.                                        |
| 23 |

| Return a system to a previously known state.                                                                                            |
| 28 |

| Duplicate an object, file, data flow, or artifact.                                                                                      |
| 30 |

| Task the recipient to aggregate and report information as it pertains to a security event or incident.                                  |
| 32 |
| Task the recipient to eliminate a vulnerability or attack point.                                                                        |

| Artifact        | 1  | An array of bytes representing a file-like object or a link to that object.                         |
| 2  |

| String          | 1  | A reference to a previously issued Command.                                                         |
| 3  |

| Device          | 1  | The properties of a hardware device.                                                                |
| 7  |

| Features        | 1  | A set of items used with the query Action to determine an Actuator's capabilities.                  |
| 10 |

| IDN-Email-Addr  | 1  | A single internationalized email address.                                                           |
| 13 |

| IPv4-Net        | 1  | An IPv4 address range including CIDR prefix length.                                                 |
| 14 |

| IPv6-Net        | 1  | An IPv6 address range including prefix length.                                                      |
| 15 |

| IPv4-Connection | 1  | A 5-tuple of source and destination IPv4 address ranges, source and destination ports, and protocol |
| 16 |

| IPv6-Connection | 1  | A 5-tuple of source and destination IPv6 address ranges, source and destination ports, and protocol |
| 20 |
| MAC-Addr        | 1  | A Media Access Control (MAC) address - EUI-48 or EUI-64 as defined in

| Process         | 1  | Common properties of an instance of a computer program as executed on an operating system.          |
| 25 |

| Properties      | 1  | Data attribute associated with an Actuator                                                          |
| 19 |

| Date-Time     | 0..1 | The specific date/time to initiate the Command                                      |
| 2  |

| Date-Time     | 0..1 | The specific date/time to terminate the Command                                     |
| 3  |

| Duration      | 0..1 | The length of time for an Command to be in effect                                   |
| 4  |
| Response-Type | 0..1 | The type of Response required for the Command:

| ArrayOf(Version) unique | 0..* | List of OpenC2 language versions supported by this Actuator         |
| 2  |

| ArrayOf(Nsid)           | 0..1  | List of profiles supported by this Actuator                         |
| 3  |

| Action-Targets          | 0..1  | List of targets applicable to each supported Action                 |
| 4  |
| Number                  | 0..1  | Maximum number of requests per minute supported by design or policy |
| MapOf(Action, Targets){1..*} | Map of each action supported by this actuator to the list of targets applicable to that action |
| ArrayOf(Pointer[Target]){1..0} unique | List of JSON Pointers to Target types |

- an interim Response used to inform the Producer that the Consumer has accepted the Command but has not yet completed it.                              |
| 200 |

- the Consumer cannot process the Command due to something that is perceived to be a Producer error (e.g., malformed Command syntax).                   |
| 401 |

- the Command Message lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource or authorization has been refused for the submitted credentials. |
| 403 |

- the Consumer understood the Command but refuses to authorize it.                                                                                       |
| 404 |

- the Consumer has not found anything matching the Command.                                                                                               |
| 500 |

- the Consumer encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from performing the Command.                                                    |
| 501 |

- the Consumer does not support the functionality required to perform the Command.                                                                  |
| 503 |
- the Consumer is currently unable to perform the Command due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the Consumer.                        |
| String  | 0..1 | Permitted values specified in the IANA Media Types registry,

| Payload | 0..1 | Choice of literal content or URL                                                   |
| 3  |
| Hashes  | 0..1 | Hashes of the payload content                                                      |

| Hostname     | 0..1 | A hostname that can be used to connect to this device over a network                    |
| 2  |

| IDN-Hostname | 0..1 | An internationalized hostname that can be used to connect to this device over a network |
| 3  |
| String       | 0..1 | An identifier that refers to this device within an inventory or management system       |
| ArrayOf(Feature){0..10} unique | An array of zero to ten names used to query an Actuator for its supported capabilities. |

| String | 0..1 | The name of the file as defined in the file system               |
| 2  |

| String | 0..1 | The absolute path to the location of the file in the file system |
| 3  |
| Hashes | 0..1 | One or more cryptographic hash codes of the file contents        |
- CIDR prefix-length. If omitted, refers to a single host address. |
- prefix length. If omitted, refers to a single host address. |
| Binary /eui     | Media Access Control / Extended Unique Identifier address - EUI-48 or EUI-64 as defined in

| Integer{0..*} | 0..1 | Process ID of the process                                                            |
| 2  |

| String         | 0..1 | Current working directory of the process                                             |
| 4  |

| File           | 0..1 | Executable that was executed to start the process                                    |
| 5  |

| Process        | 0..1 | Process that spawned this one                                                        |
| 6  |
| String         | 0..1 | The full command line invocation used to start this process, including all arguments |
| ArrayOf(String){1..*} unique | A list of names that uniquely identify properties of an Actuator. |

p._value: Specifies the results to be returned from a query features Command

_values:
| List of OpenC2 Language versions supported by this Actuator         |
| 2  |

| List of profiles supported by this Actuator                         |
| 3  |

| List of supported Actions and applicable Targets                    |
| 4  |
| Maximum number of Commands per minute supported by design or policy |
| Binary /x | 0..1 | MD5 hash as defined in
| Binary /x | 0..1 | SHA1 hash as defined in
| Binary /x | 0..1 | SHA256 hash as defined in
| String /hostname | Internet host name as specified in
| String /idn-hostname | Internationalized Internet host name as specified in
| Binary /ipv4-addr | 32 bit IPv4 address as defined in
| Binary /ipv6-addr | 128 bit IPv6 address as defined in

p._value: Value of the protocol (IPv4) or next header (IPv6) field in an IP packet. Any IANA value, [RFC5237]

_values: | String{1..16}   | A short identifier that refers to a namespace. |

| Binary | 1  | Specifies the data contained in the artifact                |
| 2  |
| URI    | 1  | MUST be a valid URL that resolves to the un-encoded content |

| Respond with progress toward Command completion |
| 3  |
| Respond when all aspects of Command completed   |
